channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cut branch of tree sticking out into the road, 10th June
item.description:
The hedge looks like it's been trimmed recently, a branch of a tree has been cut and fallen out of the hedge and it's now sticking out into the road. Two of our vans have now been damaged due to this. Today I stopped to try and find the wing mirrors, there are at least 20 in the bushes from other vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Painswick Road, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, 10th June
item.description:
A tree has fallen and is completely blocking the road between The Green and St. Bartholomew's Church.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): High Acre THE GREEN||||0|0|, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Asda shopping trolley, 10th June
item.description:
I have reported this to Asda 5 times. It had been taken further along the bridle path but, with the help of another dog Walker, I manoeuvred it back to the main road. I reported it again with it's new location but they still have not removed it. I am concerned that it will end up in the river Swillgate and that would be an environmental disaster!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Furzen Lea Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overgrown over footpath, 9th June
item.description:
Hedge is so overgrown that the path is very difficult to walk down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Croft House, 102 Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Creeper in hedge row ripped off wing mirror, 9th June
item.description:
Hedge row is encroaching on road on down hill left hand bend where traffic naturally keeps left. Contact with creeper shown ripped off my partners nearside mirror and put a dent in car door. Judging by debris in road she wasn't first victim. Didn't occur to me to photograph it but twenty yards down hill there is a cluster of dead elm saplings which appear to be collapsing into road under weight of vegetation. This road is used by cyclists travelling down hill at 30mph who could be seriously injured if they hit something poking out of hedge. Hedge needs maintenance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brydone Green Street, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpaths very Bad forget about Millfields In Hucclecote Footpaths Very Good, 9th June
item.description:
Council Could Not Find Problem,They Need To Take A Look See If You Can Walk On There Safely Without Having A Fall ,Have To Walk In Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 32 Millfields, Hucclecote

Potholes

item.title: Restricted access to pavement forcing pedestrians to walk in the road, 8th June
item.description:
The Ivy growing over the wall into St James place between Great Norwood Street and Painswick Road has now grown to a level where it is not possible to walk on the narrow pavement forcing pedestrians to walk in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Saint James' Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees too close to properties and over growing pathways, 8th June
item.description:
A number of young trees are growing within feet of the house at number 15. These trees are growing fast and will undermine the foundations of several houses if left. They are also starting to impinge upon the pathway. I report this purely out of concern for property owners.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Old Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown foliage at junction impeding sight vision of passing traffic when coming out of junction., 8th June
item.description:
Trying to turn right out of North Road West into Badgeworth Road was made dangerous as overgrown foliage impeded the visibility of approaching vehicles. Bushes 3 feet tall! Need urgently trimmed down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Turberville North Road West, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 West End Lane, Hucclecote

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Longlevens

item.title: Road Danger, 5th June
item.description:
The road outside our house is dual carriageway and the centre reservation is so overgrown it is very dangerous in your car and you cannot see cars coming from the left or your right when returning, it badly needs cutting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A38, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed wall debris on pavement, 5th June
item.description:
Bricks & stone copings from collapsed boundary wall on pavement in Queens Road - outside no.'s 66 & 68. Been there for months - no sign of anybody removing debris or sorting out wall, more of which looks like it might collapse too. Needs to be cleared up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins & recycling boxes permanently on pavement, 5th June
item.description:
Bins & recycling boxes permanently live on pavement in Glencairn Park Road, just around the corner from Queens Road. Outside no. 68 Queens Road (door on side, in Glencairn Park Road). Bins numbered 68A and 68B. Should not live on pavement - need to be located onto private property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 68a Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Adandoned roadworks sign, 5th June
item.description:
There is a random seemingly-abandoned / dumped roadworks sign on Queens Road, adjacent to the rubbish bin by the junction with Kensington Avenue. Sign has been there for weeks - no roadworks in area recently, so why it's there is anybody's guess. Needs removing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 82 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
